title: 5 possible trade targets for Patriots outside of Maxx Crosby, A.J. Brown
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Colts WR Michael Pittman Jr. and Bears WR DJ Moore are potential Patriots trade targets due to high salary cap numbers.
Jaguars OL Walker Little and Seahawks EDGE Uchenna Nwosu are rumored trade candidates, providing flexibility in roles and cap hits.
Jaguars WR Brian Thomas Jr. offers high upside for the Patriots with his big-play potential despite a subpar second season.

title: Jayson Tatum says he still doesn’t have a return date after participating in a 5-on-5 scrimmage at Celtics practice
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jayson Tatum continues rehabilitation from Achilles tear, no official return date confirmed despite recent 5-on-5 scrimmage participation.
Boston Celtics shared practice images of Tatum, fueling speculation of imminent return; Tatum downplays timeline expectations.
Tatum practiced with Maine Celtics and participated in limited activities, but team's focus remains on full recovery before return.

title: NBC Sports broadcast teams rise to the occasion with Olympic calls from Milan Cortina
author: Chad Finn
bullets: NBC Sports broadcasters Kenny Albert and A.J. Mleczko called Team USA's 2-1 gold-medal win over Canada in women's hockey.
Terry Gannon, Tara Lipinski, and Johnny Weir provided minimal commentary during Alysa Liu's gold-winning figure skating performance.
Providence had the highest TV ratings for the Super Bowl, with Boston and Seattle coming in third and fifth, respectively.

title: Free MBTA bus program extended â€” for now
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Boston extends free rides on MBTA Routes 23, 28, and 29 through June using leftover pandemic funds.
Mayor Michelle Wu launched the fare-free initiative in March 2022 with $8 million in federal COVID-19 relief funds.
The future of the program is uncertain as discussions with the MBTA and potential funding sources continue.

title: Snow totals: See how much snow your town got
author: Boston.com Staff
bullets: Franklin County reported the highest snow totals with Leyden receiving 6.5 inches as of 7 a.m. on February 21.
Essex County recorded significant snowfall with two locations in Haverhill observing around 5 inches by morning on February 21.
The National Weather Service in Boston forecasts a high-impact blizzard for Sunday night into Monday with potential power outages.

title: She’s running the 2026 Boston Marathon for the 2013 bombing victims
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Marissa LaRosa, 30, from Canton, is running the 2026 Boston Marathon in memory of the 2013 bombing victims.
She attributes her inspiration to a coworker who has completed the marathon 24 times, providing guidance and motivation.
The 2026 Boston Marathon will be held on April 20, a meaningful date for LaRosa as she achieves a personal dream.

title: NH man sentenced for using $1M in COVID relief funds to buy golf course
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Michael Kirouac, 38, sentenced to 15 months for wire fraud using $1 million in COVID relief funds.
Kirouac used $600,000 in Economic Injury Disaster Loans to buy the Angus Lea Golf Course.
Prosecutors stated Kirouac fraudulently secured loans for companies he owned or controlled during the pandemic.

title: Man with 25-year record charged in high-end Boston shoplifting spree
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Peter Cutelis, 40, was arraigned on charges of larceny and drug possession for multiple thefts in Boston's Back Bay.
Cutelis allegedly stole over $7,000 worth of merchandise from Lululemon and Ralph Lauren stores in November.
A judge set Cutelis's bail at $2,500; he faces additional charges as a fugitive from New Hampshire.

title: Red Sox will keep Roman Anthony in leadoff spot for 2026 season. What could rest of lineup look like?
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Red Sox manager Alex Cora confirms Roman Anthony as leadoff hitter for the 2026 season.
Despite a season-ending injury, Anthony hit .336 as leadoff in his rookie year.
Willson Contreras set as Red Sox cleanup; Trevor Story may hit second in lineup.

title: Margo Price talks AI, bro-country and meeting Joan Baez at the circus
author: Lauren Daley
bullets: Margo Price discusses her influences, including Joan Baez, ahead of her Boston show at The Royale on February 21.
Price's latest album "Hard Headed Woman," nominated for two Grammys, highlights her defiance and distinct presence in mainstream country.
Price reveals a personal connection to Massachusetts, where her husband Jeremy Ivey once lived and experienced homelessness.
